content.description: Right around the end of Funny Business Wall the crag has two more climbs.  After a blocky start the route gets steep and has excellent, sustained face climbing to the top anchors.
content.location: At the right end of the South Facing Funny Business Wall, the crag continues around the corner and has a brief east aspect before petering out.  Just For Laughs is the left line and Hee-Haw is the right most line.

content.description: Work up a few bolts to the base of blunt arete/buttress.  Very hard moves through the bulge lead to slightly easier but sustained climbing to the top.
content.location: Just right of Funny Business start.

content.description: Looooved this climb! Crux right at the top where you have to climb a crack to get to the top. JB led, I followed on top rope. My first taste of crack - and I became instantly addicted!
content.protection:
4 bolts, slab to crack to face

Can't remember what type of anchors at the top.

content.description: Carefully climb over a grassy spot with a small bush at the bolt to good climbing in the left facing corner above.
content.location: Start directly behind the big cedar tree at the base of Funny Business Wall.  Shares the first bolt with Slap Stick.

content.description: Climb up the prow of the Funny Business Wall, several technical cruxes.
content.location: Climbs the right hand edge of Funny Business Wall and starts 6 feet right of and shares top anchors with the The Punchline.

content.description: At the first bolt pull up right onto the slab and work the steepening face with a hand on the arete and a hand in the shallow corner/seam.  Fun climbing.
content.location: Start behind the big cedar tree at the base of Funny Business Wall, just to right of Vegematic.  First bolt has a small metal name tag attached.

content.description: Climb onto the slab and continue up as it steepens.  Second crux on the more featured rock above.
Steep face climbing right of the Giggles corner.  Clip the first bolt of Yuk/Giggles then move slightly right up independent bolt line.  Sustained, steep finish.
content.location: Right side of Funny Business Wall, share starting move with Yuk It Up and Giggles.

content.description: Work up a tough flared left facing dihedral to a stance on the right.  Step left back into the corner and pull the short bulge with gymnastics moves and a jam or two.  Continue to the top anchors.
content.location: Deep corner just right of The Improv arete.  Look for the frog head at the base.

content.description: Short, manufactured route from the early 90's.  Hard pulls on drilled mono-digit pockets.
Climb up a shallow left facing corner to a stance on the right.  Continue up a right facing corner until you can move out right to the top anchors.  Crux in each corner
content.location: Ten feet right of No Laughing Matter. Shares top anchors with The Improv.

climbs.name: Joke'em if They Can't Take a Fuck

content.description: Pull onto the slab and work up a cream colored streak with a thin seam.  Continue into a shallow left facing corner.
Work up the arete between two corner systems.
content.location: Arete between Jokes On You and Kermit The Frog.  Shares top anchors with Jokes On You.

content.description: Right most bolt line of the Funny Business Area.
content.location: At the right end of the South Facing Funny Business Wall, the crag continues around the corner and has a brief east aspect before petering out.  Just For Laughs is the left line and Hee-Haw is the right most line.

climbs.name: Good For A Laugh Or Two

content.description: Pull a bulge and diagonal up and right to a short dihedral.  At the top of the dihedral do a hard pull on to a steep face and follow the face/seam to the top.
content.location: Start at the same location as Kermit the Frog but move right and pull the bulge.

content.description: Great dihedral and fun climbing.  Clip the first 3 bolts of Yuk It Up and move into the right facing dihedral.  Lieback, jam, and stem to the top anchors.
content.location: Same start as Yuk It Up and The Punchline.

content.description: Start under a close to the ground roof and pull onto a slab.  Continue up corners/cracks to the top anchors.

Start to the right of Good For A Laugh Or Two and climb directly to the short dihedral.  Pull up onto the big ledge.  Hard laybacking off the ledge leads to more face climbing.  Don't blow the second clip off the ledge.
content.location: Starts right of Good For A Laugh Or Two and after sharing 2 bolts crosses this route.

content.description: Seemed a lot easier than Minnie (10a/b). Flashed it on top rope (JB leading)
content.protection:
4 bolts, slab to dihedral

Can't remember what kind of anchor at top
content.location:
none given - please use "update this page" feature.

thanks - admin
